page.title: 13Charleston Farm,Grindale
page.content: This is a farm of 514 acres. The old farm house was made of chalk.In 1982 they built on a brick extension. They have 2 old cattle sheds now used as stores. They have a big corn and cabbage store built with an E.E.C. grant. It is made of galvanised iron and asbestos sheeting. There is a big tractor shed and a cold store to keep cabbages in. They have just 4 big fields of 171, 105, 174 and 59 acres. They have 100 acres of cabbage, 130 acres of barley and 270 acres of wheat. They have 700-800 sheep from October to February which are fed on cabbage leaves and then sold as fat hogs. They employ 2 full time workers and 4 on cabbages for 10 months and 4 for harvesting cabbages for 3 months. They have 5 International tractors and 1 Deutz tractor.
